findings.title: Redundant outer scope declaration and mutability of local variables
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Declare the variables where they are assigned
findings.description: Variables should be declared at the point of assignment to improve code readability and prevent potential issues.

findings.title: Unnecessary Parameters
findings.description: The mint and authority parameters are always the same at the call site; therefore, the function can be optimized by having only one of them instead of two.

findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: The owner has complete control over token distribution and can arbitrarily forge or censor user claims.

findings.title: Gas and Loops
findings.description: Inefficient code pattern for matching accounts between ctx.remaining_accounts and users_info in a loop produces error-checking boilerplate to extract the single found account in users_info.

findings.title: Compiler Warnings
findings.description: It is preferable for a production project to have the programming language version pinned explicitly.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: Smart contract data should be consistent all over the data flow.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: Code coverage of the project is about 90%. Some instructions are tested but their effects are not checked during testing.

findings.title: I03. Floating Language Version
findings.description: It is preferable for a production project to have the programming language version pinned explicitly.

findings.title: C01. Incorrect Value
findings.description: Incorrect values are used in the documentation of several constants and variables in lib.rs and token_math.rs files.

findings.title: H01. Unset Or Unsettable Token Metadata
findings.description: The SPL-token mint account of Sallar token is a PDA of the program and the mint authority is also a PDA of the program, which guarantees that the token management functions can only be performed by the program code. However, the program code does not set the token metadata nor provides an API to set it later.

findings.title: H02. Stuck Funds
findings.description: Funds stuck in final staking account due to exponential decay of balance over time, making it difficult to extract 70% or more of the initial balance.

findings.title: M01. Invalid Hardcoded Value
findings.description: Hardcoded values duplicate constant definitions.

findings.title: M02. Immutable Ownership
findings.description: The contract is designed in a way that ownership cannot be transferred. This may lead to the impossibility to update the owner in critical situations.
